newsitem.title: USA: Macromedia Inc sees "substantial" Q4 loss.
newsitem.headline: Macromedia Inc sees "substantial" Q4 loss.

text.p: Macromedia Inc said late Tuesday that it was expecting "a substantial loss" in the fourth quarter because of a delay in the release of its Director 6 Multimedia Studio.
The company said the delay will result in "substantially lower revenues than expected and a substantial loss" for the quarter ending March 31.

Macromedia attributed the delay to technical errors which it said had not been resolved during final stages of the quality assurance process. It said it would release Director 6 in the June quarter rather than this month as planned.
"While the decision will have an adverse impact on our fourth quarter financial results, we believe that it is the right thing to do for our customers," the company release said.
No one at Macromedia was immediately available for further comment.

Wall Street had been expecting the San Francisco-based company to report earnings of $0.02 per share for the quarter and $0.26 per share for the full year, according to First Call consensus estimates.
